items.q: How do I start programming as a beginner?
items.a: Start small: pick one language (Python is beginner-friendly), learn basics (variables, loops, functions), then build 2-3 mini projects. Consistency beats speed.

items.q: How do I prepare for exams effectively?
items.a: Use active recall + spaced repetition: make short notes, practice questions daily, and revise at increasing intervals. Solve previous years papers and track weak topics.

items.q: What is the difference between AI, ML, and Deep Learning?
items.a: AI is the broad field. ML is a subset where systems learn from data. Deep Learning is a subset of ML using neural networks with many layers.
Try the 5-minute start: commit to working for just 5 minutes. Use a timer (Pomodoro 25/5) and remove distractions. Small wins build momentum.
